TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , a village in LOC of LOC . The respondent Government were represented by Mr P. A. NORP , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE ORG of LOC dissolved the applicant ’s marriage .

On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against his former wife , requesting partition of a house of QUANTITY sq . m. total surface and other property acquired before the divorce . On DATE the ORG of the LOC discontinued proceedings in the case because of the withdrawal of the action by the applicant who had reached a settlement agreement with the defendant . The applicant did not appeal but later , on an unspecified date , since the defendant had failed to adhere to the settlement agreement , successfully pursued the supervisory review procedure - an extraordinary remedy provided for by the NORP legislation .

In the course of supervisory review proceedings , on DATE , the ORG of ORG quashed the decision of DATE in view of procedural defects ( it had not been explained to the applicant that his withdrawal of the action would deprive him of a right to re - lodge the same action in the future ) and ordered a fresh examination of the case by the same ORG .

The examination of the case was then adjourned several times : on CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE on the defendant ’s request ; on DATE on the applicant ’s request and on CARDINAL DATE because of the parties’ failure to appear .
On DATE ORG ordered an expert opinion concerning the value of the house . It was obtained on DATE .
On DATE the hearing was adjourned as the parties failed to appear .
On DATE the proceedings were suspended due to the applicant ’s illness .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim concerning the partition of the house and awarded a sum corresponding to his share in the house , to be paid by the defendant . Following the applicant ’s appeal , on DATE , ORG quashed the judgment in part concerning the division of the house , pointing out that the first instance court should have examined the technical possibility of the physical partition of the house , after obtaining an expert opinion if necessary , and ordered a fresh examination of the issue .
On DATE ORG ordered another expert opinion concerning the value of the disputed house and repair works made before the dissolution of the marriage . The expert opinion was obtained on DATE .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the examination of the case was adjourned because of the parties’ failure to appear .

On DATE ORG awarded the applicant compensation for the repairs , rejecting the rest of his claims . On DATE the applicant requested the court to restore the time - limit for appealing against the judgment . On DATE the court granted the request . On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment of DATE , as it lacked reasons and references to material and procedural law , and ordered a fresh examination of the case by the same court .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the hearing was adjourned due to the parties’ failure to appear .

On DATE ORG ordered CARDINAL more expert opinion , asking whether it would be possible physically to divide the house , taking into account the applicant ’s entitlement to CARDINAL of the money spent on its repairs . The expert opinion was obtained in DATE .

On DATE the court found that the partition of the house was impossible and ordered the defendant to pay the applicant pecuniary compensation . The applicant did not appeal and the judgment became final on DATE .

On DATE the bailiff ’s service found that the defendant had no property which could be seized . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were closed because of the transfer of the writs of execution to a local social security authority for deductions to be made from the defendant ’s pension . There is a certificate of a local pension fund dated DATE confirming that regular deductions were made from the defendant ’s pension by way of execution of the judgment .

As the deductions from the defendant ’s pension were so small as to make the prospect of the prompt execution of the judgment unrealistic , on DATE the applicant attempted to bring a new action against the defendant , again requesting the partition of the house . On DATE the Justice of the Peace of ORG of the Kurskiy District of LOC refused to examine the action , because it raised an issue substantially the same as the one which had been decided by the judgment of DATE . On DATE the ORG of LOC upheld this decision on appeal .
